summary: This document is an FAA Form 337 detailing the major repair and alteration of an aircraft, specifically the installation of a Traffic Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) on a Boeing 727-31. It includes information about the aircraft's registration, the work performed, and the individuals involved in the certification of the work. This document contains various FAA forms related to major repairs and alterations performed on a Boeing 727 aircraft with registration N908JE. It includes details about the aircraft's ownership, repair work accomplished, and certifications by authorized individuals. The document is subject to a protective order. This document details major repairs and alterations performed on a Boeing 727-100 aircraft, including the installation of an AirCell Iridium ST-3100 system and various maintenance activities. It includes compliance statements, descriptions of work accomplished, and approvals from FAA representatives. This document is a flight manual supplement for the Banyan Air Service's Universal Avionics Flight Management System (FMS) UNS-1D+. It outlines the installation, navigation approvals, limitations, and normal procedures for operating the FMS, including emergency procedures and approach operations. The document is significant for understanding the technical specifications and operational guidelines for the aircraft's navigation system. This document contains technical details regarding the maintenance and alterations performed on a Boeing 727-100 aircraft, specifically focusing on the installation of a Universal Avionics Terrain Awareness Warning System (TAWS). It includes information about the aircraft's registration, owner, and the procedures followed for the installation and testing of the new systems. This document contains technical details and compliance statements related to the modification and maintenance of a Boeing 727-31 aircraft, specifically regarding the installation of dual Universal Avionics Flight Management Systems. It includes emergency procedures, performance specifications, and FAA compliance statements. This document contains multiple entries related to major repairs and alterations made to a Boeing 727-31 aircraft, registration N908JE. It includes details about the owner, repair stations, and specific alterations performed on the aircraft's interior furnishings and systems. This document details major repairs and alterations made to a Boeing 727-31 aircraft, including the installation of an Eventide Avionics Argus 5000/CE Moving Map Display. It includes compliance with FAA regulations and outlines the work accomplished, including updates to weight and balance records. This document contains compliance statements and modifications related to the installation of dual Universal Avionics Flight Management Systems on a Boeing 727-31 aircraft. It details the structural alterations, inspections, and approvals necessary for the aircraft to meet Federal Aviation Regulations. This document contains multiple statements of compliance with Federal Aviation Regulations related to various modifications and alterations made to a Boeing 727-31 aircraft, serial number 20115. The modifications include installations of GPS antennas, communication systems, and other equipment, all of which require FAA approval and compliance with specific regulations. This document details major repairs accomplished on a Boeing 727-31 aircraft, registration number N505LS, including repairs to corroded seat tracks and engine components. It includes approvals from designated engineering representatives and confirms compliance with FAA regulations. This document contains various statements of compliance and repair records related to a Boeing 727-31 aircraft, specifically focusing on modifications, repairs, and inspections performed on the aircraft. It includes details about the aircraft's registration, maintenance work, and compliance with Federal Aviation Regulations. This document contains various operational limitations and requirements for a Boeing 727-100 aircraft, including details about its airworthiness and compliance with FAA regulations. It outlines the conditions under which the aircraft can be operated, including restrictions on carrying passengers and the need for specific pilot qualifications. This document contains details regarding the operating limitations and requirements for an experimental aircraft, specifically a Boeing 727-100. It outlines the conditions under which the aircraft can operate, including restrictions on carrying passengers and the need for FAA compliance. The document also includes a request for an airworthiness certificate for a specific flight demonstration. This document contains various FAA forms and certificates related to the airworthiness of a Boeing 727-31 aircraft, including operational limitations and compliance with aviation regulations. It outlines the requirements for operating the aircraft and the necessary certifications for pilots and maintenance. This document contains various entries related to the maintenance and modifications of a Boeing 727-31 aircraft, registration N505C. It includes details about compliance with FAA regulations, alterations made to the aircraft, and the installation of various systems and components. The document is subject to protective orders, indicating sensitive information may be included.

connections.description: Steve Ouellette is the authorized individual who certified the work done by Richard C. Saltivan.
Steve Ouellette's work on the aircraft required approval from Robert Belgau, who certified the installation of the antenna.
Steve Ouellette's work was subject to approval by Gary Justice, who is responsible for overseeing compliance with FAA regulations.
Both individuals are involved in the inspection and approval process for the aircraft repairs.
Both are certified mechanics involved in the repair and alteration of the aircraft.
John K. Ursa, as an inspector, works under the management of Ronald K. BretrOn, who oversees quality.
G.L. Karr prepared the modification drawing which was approved by T. Jardine.
David E. Haralson, as an FAA Administrator, provides compliance oversight that Ronald K. BretrOn manages.
John K. Urso and Ronald K. Bystrom are both involved in the inspection and approval process for the aircraft modifications.
Both David E. Haralson and Robert J. Belgau are designated engineering representatives involved in the approval of modifications to the aircraft.
Ronald K. Bystrom oversees the quality assurance process, which includes the work done by John K. Urso.

events.title: Major Repair and Alteration
events.description: Major repairs were accomplished on the Boeing 727-100, including the installation of an AirCell Iridium system.

events.title: Installation of AirCell Iridium Antenna
events.description: An AirCell Iridium antenna was installed on the aircraft as part of the avionics upgrade.

events.title: Approval of Flight Manual Supplement
events.description: Gary Justice approved the airplane flight manual supplement for the aircraft after the installation of the Universal Avionics Systems Corporation.

events.title: Approval for Return to Service
events.description: The aircraft was inspected and approved for return to service after alterations were made.

events.title: Repairs and Alterations Completed
events.description: Multiple repairs and alterations were completed on the aircraft, including upholstery and system replacements.

events.title: Major Repairs and Alterations
events.description: Major repairs and alterations were accomplished on the Boeing 727-31 aircraft, including the installation of a new moving map display system.

events.title: Major Alteration to Boeing 727-31
events.description: A major alteration was completed on the Boeing 727-31 aircraft, including the installation of dual Universal Avionics Flight Management Systems.

events.title: FAA Approval of Flight Manual Supplement
events.description: The FAA approved a supplement to the Airplane Flight Manual for the Boeing 727-31 following the installation of new systems.

events.title: Statement of Compliance
events.description: Multiple statements of compliance were issued for various modifications made to the Boeing 727-31 aircraft.

events.title: Market Survey Flight
events.description: A flight from Paine Field, Everett, Washington to Grant County Airport, Moses Lake, Washington for a demonstration of the Stage II Noise Characteristics.
